website_summaries.verdict: A perfect companion in the workshop or on a job site that does precisely what it’s designed for.
pros: Very lightweight, at under 5 pounds, and compact, folding nearly flat, yet this little workbench is mighty tough, supporting up to 350 pounds
A flat surface and perfectly aligned peg holes help ensure accuracy when cutting
Clamps hold tight and accept pressure without twisting the item being secured
cons: The rubber foot caps tend to slip off, and table may sway under heavier loads without some kind of bracing

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a portable miter saw table
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a portable miter saw table using the included swivel grip pegs to clamp the saw in place. I now just leave the saw clamped in the table and store them both that way.
customer_reviews.author: Chargeit

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for what it is. The only ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job for what it is. The only hard about the assembly is knocking in the lock pins for the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Herman L.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I love this thing. it works great for the money. is it a high end professional mini work bench? Hell no but for an amateur like me it's perfect. I live in a 2 bedroom apartment with little room and I can pop this thing open on my deck or in living room do my "whatever" fold it back up and put it in a closet. the things kind of a pain to assemble but ounce done it's great. The biggest pain is trying to hammer the little pegs to keep the vice handles on,you have to really pound on them with hammer to get them in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: $25 Table works like a $75 table.
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy this because it was only $25. I thought that it wouldn't hold up once I started using it. I was wrong, and I'm glad I ordered it. I would say that this will best be suited for small projects around the house. I used it to cut 8 foot landscaping timbers. The table remained balanced and didn't tilt with the weight of the timbers. I recommend watching the YouTube video for assembly. Go ahead and take a chance as I did. You won't be disappointed.... as long as you're a small project person.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, Minus the Toxicity
customer_reviews.text: Got this put together and used it on a project last week. It's a wonderful design and for light work it's a spectacular tool. That said, PLEASE be aware of the Proposition 65 warning. If you have a compromised immune system, are in cancer remission, are elderly or using around children, I strongly urge you to purchase something else. The formaldehyde off-gassing notwithstanding, if you accidentally sand into this product and inhale its dust, or get it wet and the residue gets on your skin it can adversely impact your health. Black & Decker DOES NOT adhere to the CA Prop 65 or (former) EPA guidelines regarding known carcinogenic materials in its products. Cool design though!
customer_reviews.author: Goodkat

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one .. please
customer_reviews.text: VERY POOR QUALITY .. missing parts .. waste of time Years ago I purchased a B&D workmate ( larger version ) ... and it was excellent .. my son "borrowed" it ... Anyway this unit appears to be from a 3rd rate assembler .. don't waste your time or money .. the thing was barely able to stand upright and the pieces had poor alignment. Also ( my fault ) I didn't realize it was missing an entire vise assembly (right one) .. that's when I said F it .. its going back ....and I almost never return anything just to avoid the hassel factor
customer_reviews.author: gary mize

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Like several others, I still own one of the original B&D work benches, solid as rocks. This one does the job in spite of feeling somewhat less sturdy. But so far no problems (other than that it is not the same height, which is slightly annoying as I wanted the benches to support longer work and I have to add a 'layer' to get them to work at same height).
customer_reviews.author: RMS

customer_reviews.title: Table height is too low.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good value. Not bad it you are going to use it occasionally but if you are going to use it a lot, get an upgrade Workmate that is sturdier and has a much higher table work height than this one. I got this one for using at my vacation home but I have a 50 year old Workmate at my other home that is far superior in every way. For the price it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: David Des

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small townhouse, with no garage but needed a work bench that was small and compact. This checked my boxes! Overall, I am pretty dang pleased with this purchase. Pros: -It folds very easily, and stores away well. -Easy to maneuver. -Great for the price point. -Sturdy (but not as sturdy as an industrial one, clearly great for small to medium projects) Cons: -Instructions were a bit of a pain. (not difficult, just frustrating) -A bit on the short side, and I'm 5'2" Clearly, no major flaws to the work bench. I'm very happy with the purchase, and I've been getting a lot of projects done that I have had on hold for a long time!!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Downs

customer_reviews.title: Worst workmanship ever!
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in a badly damaged box and I was surprised all the parts were there as the top was completely ripped. This thing is IMPOSSIBLE to assemble. The letters next to each listed part do not correspond to those on assembly instructions so I went to YouTube video, great. Well, the holes don’t line up so you’d have to drill new holes. Zero quality assurance. Worst workmanship I have ever come across. Shame on you Black and Decker!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap and it works.
customer_reviews.text: It's a low cost workbench and it works as well as you could hope. My only complaint is with the assembly process. While it's not exactly a complex process, you'll see that as early as step 2 the instructions start to leave out details that, in my case, forced me to basically start over by step 4. Then it gets worse when you notice that the cheap bolts they send for you to use are stripped from the first time you attached them. It's ultimately a minor inconvenience, but it's very frustrating. It could have been avoided easily with just labeling the pieces in the assembly photos more, but they don't.
customer_reviews.author: KateOhWait

customer_reviews.title: Decent and useful product, horrible assembly instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Workmate primarily to use as a stand for my new compound sliding miter saw. With a few extra mounting holes, it has worked beautifully for that purpose. It is reasonably sturdy, although the handles for the screws to adjust the separation between the boards do not inspire much confidence. So why only 3 stars? Same reason as everyone else - the dad-gummed assembly instructions!! The illustrations are worse than useless; they are misleading. Forewarned by other reviews, I used the YouTube video and pretty much ignored the instructions when things got difficult, which was right from the beginning. Too bad they weaken a solid product with such awful instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shroyer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: The WM125 has useful features and I see myself using it regularly. However, assembly was quite aggravating. The instruction booklet is terrible where in the diagrams and and written instructions do not make any sense. I read the assembly instructions a few times and was starting to think that I was dumb until I read the other negative reviews on amazon about the assembly instructions provided. The youtube video is little bit better but they should have provided more details to make the assembly simpler. Bottom line is that I didnt want to be spending so much time assembling a 20 dollar bench.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. All the people saying it was hard to build must have head injuries. I had it done in 20 minutes. The hardest part was hammering the handles on. But don't be a little wussy about it and they'll go right in. You really have to smash those suckers HARD. Pretend the handles are a dog clamped onto your groin and that it's skull is made of steel. The only way to free yourself is to kill the dog. That's how you must hammer in the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: The table is great the directions are quite terrible
customer_reviews.text: After reading previous reviews about how difficult this was to put together I was already mentally prepared. I am not one of those people that can easily fit things together by looking at them. I am highly reliant on directions. Despite the horrible directions and the fact they were not in sequence I still put it together. In fact I felt quite proud of myself. It's a sturdy table and I'm very pleased with it. You can't beat this price and though I haven't used it yet I did experiment and everything worked perfectly. I recommend it. If you're on the fence give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: LolasMom

customer_reviews.title: No problem at all with putting it together.
customer_reviews.text: I'd say there's a high probability that 90% of the reviews that can't get it put together is just incompetence. There was no problem putting it together as the directions (which aren't nearly as bad as made out to be either) said. I do consider myself fairly handy and have grown up using tools so it seemed pretty common sense to assemble to me. It seems sturdy enough for the price. I wouldn't have any qualms about putting 250+ lbs on it. As long as you don't expect this to replace a bench vice then I don't see much any problems that could arise using it.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Thirteen years and countless projects
customer_reviews.text: Came to find a replacement part and Amazon shows that I bought this bench 13 years ago. Can't even begin to estimate all the projects I've used this for. For under $30 delivered to your door, it's a fantastic value. Plenty sturdy for lumber and sheets of plywood, though I've never thought about standing on it. The vise works well at clamping. I also appreciate that it is lightweight and compact when folded so easily transportabl and stowable. Don't recall any problems with assembly and the feet have never fallen off. One of the plastic wingnuts for the legs finally broke. Once I replace that, I expect it will last another dozen years.
customer_reviews.author: GearGuy

customer_reviews.title: Light duty
customer_reviews.text: This is not half bad. Perfect for what I need it for which is fairly light duty kind of work. Good price on this and fast shipping, it arrived 2 days early. As far as assembly goes, my first tip is to throw away the instructions it comes with. It would take you hours to assemble this thing following the written instructions, Go to YouTube and you will find a great video on how to but this together, took me about 20 minutes following the video instructions. Nice that it folds up and can be hung. Overall for what it cost I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions were not true to manual. I had to go to a you tube video for further instructions and ablib on the rest. Railing boards were not lining up. Folding bench up for storage is a struggle. Would not recommend. Update ********* I finally was able to get the work bench working properly after 3 days of working at it ( actually 3 hours spread over 3 days.). Its pretty sturdy, not sure of the durability over time) so I will change my rating to 3 stars. Instruction manual was incorrect. Go to you tube for correct instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price--stupid directions
customer_reviews.text: I build birdhouses and live in an apartment so this is a perfect use for this product. Reading reviews was definitely helpful--e.g. using screws instead of roller pins on swivel handles, adding lock washers to improve stability. Easy peasy. I figured out that there was an illustration left out of the directions, but they were poor directions anyway so used some common sense and did watch the B&D video, though it was marginally helpful. Also, screws I received were phillips head, not straight head. Good little puzzle to solve and kept me out of trouble for a bit! :)
customer_reviews.author: E A. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great table, but frustrating to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: You have to have the eyes of an eagle, the mind of an engineer, and the patience of a saint to assemble this (not to mention four hands). The illustrations are so small as to be pretty much useless, and the instructions are not well written. When assembling the top back section, not only does the illustration ignore the instructions, but skips whole steps. Luckily, after screaming in frustration and stomping around to work off steam, we were able to figure out how to put it together. A suggestion: skip trying to hammer in the handle pins. Go get a long enough cotter pin to thread through and secure the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Impossible Assembly - Manufacturing Flaw
customer_reviews.text: It was impossible to set the metal pins that hold the handles onto the cranks. They were too big - even after freezing them to shrink the pin diameter. It advises using a hammer to pound them in. They went part way in then got stuck. A ten pound sledge might have worked but would have been impractical. Had to use pliers to dislodge the partially set pin and replace it with a cotter pin in order to use the product. Bad tooling. Not worthy of the B&D name.
customer_reviews.author: Jack McNally

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions but works for my application
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are EXTREMELY poor -- incorrect and incomplete written steps -- diagrams that are wrong and conflict with written steps -- some parts are labeled incorrectly. B&D should be ashamed -- a complete rewrite/re-diagram is in order. But after I abandoned the instructions and just used common sense, I was able to properly assemble the bench. I found them to be secure. I'm using a pair of these as sawhorses...very sturdy. I won't be using these as a work bench or vise...if that's your intent, keep in mind it's quite small.
customer_reviews.author: MyOnlineOpinions

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and assembly is not too bad
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews I was curious to try and assemble this thing. It wasn't too bad but maybe it's because it's a lot of the reviews made it sound impossible so my expectations were off. Don't worry too much about the setup, I would recommend using your own screws though instead of the rolled dowel pins....those things make no sense. Anyway, the workbench is perfect. It's a great price and provides a good hold for basic woodworking. I use it mainly for sawing and sanding. It folds up easily and takes up little space. Very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: CharlieTop Contributor: Philosophy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the original Workmate which became increasingly difficult to fold and unfold. This version is much easier to fold and folds flatter. Its also much lighter. I was able to use it saw down a large tree branch that had fallen and it proved solid and stable. Assembly was a little difficult in assembling the a large adjustment screws, especially the turn handles. A different way of attaching the handles rather than the pin that had to be hammered in would be a lot better. But once assembled it worked well. I am a little concerned about the plastic nuts wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Scottgem

customer_reviews.title: If you're working on small projects and needed stable surface to work on this is what you should get.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a worktable for various projects and this fits perfectly! It's sturdy, it folds up to about 5 inches, and it holds the job tightly. The other thing that I bought with this was two Starrett Measure Stix SM44ME Steel White Measure Tape with Adhesive Backing. I attach this to either side of the table so now I can do measurements as I do my job set up (other versions of this table have the measurements etched into the top). If you're working on small projects and needed stable surface to work on this is what you should get.
customer_reviews.author: JimR

customer_reviews.title: A great product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: A great product for the money! I had a home improvement project that entailed a lot of lumber sawing and the drilling of mounting holes in the lumber. I bought this bench because of its capabilities to clamp and secure objects and it served its purpose as advertised, providing a secure and stable platform for measuring, sawing, and drilling. Assembly was straight forward. I could not have finished my project without it. And lastly, but very important, all the parts were there, something that I don't take for granted anymore when purchasing anything that requires assembly.
customer_reviews.author: valley9

customer_reviews.title: Great value for typical occasional help with home projects
customer_reviews.text: Good for what most people need to clamp/hold for projects. Actual "builders" will need the sturdier models but this is great for my needs and very inexpensive. Wish I had it when I was redoing the deck! Assembly isn't to bad but it needs a new system for attaching the screw handles. Hammering in the little slotted spring pins was insane and took more time then the rest of the assembly. I should have tossed them and used a simple cotter pin or something.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible quality. I bought this time years ago and just recently remembered how bad it was. None of the holes in it were cut right so the table was completely unable to be assembled. It was a Christmas gift, we ended up having to go to a local store to buy one and we trashed this thing. Horrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: Well let me say that when it was all together it did perform well. My issues like so many others is the instructions and difficult assembly. The instructions are very poor to read and make out what they are trying to illustrate. I have put together thousands of units and I must say this one tested me. The toughest part for me was trying to put the pins in that hold both of the cranking knobs. No way would they go in and I had to open the holes with my drill in order to seat them properly. I like the workmate but B & D need to make some changes.
customer_reviews.author: Orangemen

customer_reviews.title: Really bad quality control.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted, the size and weight are just right for limited spaces and I think it will be perfect for me. The reason I’m giving it only 3 stars is because the front crossbrace is about 6 inches too long- obviously meant for a different bench. Despite that I was able to assemble it without that piece and it seems like it will hold together all right, since I don’t plan on putting anything heavy on it. When I tried contacting customer service via the Black and Decker website, the links wouldn’t work- another reason for the mediocre rating. If the front crossbrace had been the right size I wouldn’t hesitate to give this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Feather

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for aggravation.
customer_reviews.text: Decent enough for the money..removed 2 stars because the assembly is a PITA! Instructions are very poor and the online video is just marginally helpfull. Took me well over an hour and I have certainly had my share of putting together all kinds of furniture, toys, and equipment. It really helps to just figure it out yourself because the instructions will just get you confused. I did better looking at the picture on the box and trying to make sense of it. Do get the 6-32 1 1/4" machine screws and save yourself even more headache with the handles assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Hmaxim

customer_reviews.title: A Workbench I Can Work With
customer_reviews.text: I noticed some folks were having difficulties with assembly when I read the reviews and while I realize many of us have various skills, don't let these reviews intimidate you or discourage you if you want a great workbench at a great price. Face it, if you need a workbench in the first place, you must be good with your hands and are comfortable with a wrench and a screwdriver. I'm super happy with my purchase of this table and I believe you will be too. Give it a go and tell 'em I sent ya!.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesy

customer_reviews.title: its $25, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: its really just OK. its $25, you get what you pay for. it doesn't open very wide and doesn't lay very flat on the wall - about 4 inch thick. its a little flimsy but yeah its 25$. so *shrugs* ps - you can't fit a bike seat in between the wood bars to actually do what they have in that picture, so if you are thinking of getting this to fix bikes or something, it will not work at all. they must have taken off, then reattached the seat once in the wood bars to make that photo look the way it is. i'm not sure what's the point of lying about something so random
customer_reviews.author: attilakb

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This was hard for me to assemble as I have no experience with assembling benches, using nuts and bolts, etc. I found the directions confusing, so I watched a video over and over on YouTube and cross referenced with the written directions. I just had to keep trying until I got it and I really feel the written instructions could have been much clearer. It was very frustating for me as a non mechanical persin. Once I finally did get it together I was really happy with how it's going to work. It's the right size, folds and opens easily, and is a great price. If you are experienced with assembling things, I'm sure it will be a lot easier!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Swanton

customer_reviews.title: Super useful in a small apartment!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is great! I live in an apartment and don't have any extra storage or work spaces, so I like having this to hold small projects, work on potted plants, even hold up an easel a bit higher. I got a cheap 4x5' tarp to put underneath when sawing, sanding or working with dirt. The vise works well and stays tight as long as you screw in both sides a bit at a time. Folds into a relatively small volume to lie against the wall, isn't completely flat but for $25 I can't ask more. Feels like this is going to last a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Ze Amazon Cuztomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Solid Design
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to use more or less as saw horses. I found them to be sturdy, stable, and well thought out. They fold fairly flat, don't weigh much, and the clamp works well. I'll find several uses for them. As for ease of assembly, I did not find it difficult. You have to hammer in a roll pin at one point and the parts being hammered on won't be well supported while you apply a few stout blows to the pin. It's OK. Hammering can be cathartic. Overall a great value if these meet your requirements.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Fathers Workmate
customer_reviews.text: I own an old Black and Decker Workmate which I have had for about 30 years. I have a summer home and thought I would purchase a second one for a project here. What a difference! I spent almost 2 hours trying to decipher the instructions and assembling the workmate. Once I had it put together it was nothing like the original. It is much smaller, lighter, and not nearly as sturdy. I think they should call it the Playmate instead of Workmate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bench b/c I am stripping, sanding & painting my kitchen cabinets. I am not a carpenter and I gave only 3 stars for “ease of assembly” as the instructions used terms with which I was unfamiliar. I was finally able to get it together using some common sense. The step-by-step pictures were of no help what so ever. But, once together, it was just what I needed to work on this project. The adjustable pegs were particularly helpful for holding the different sized doors in place when sanding. It’s supposed to hold up to 350 lbs, ( I didn’t have anything that heavy) but it’s pretty sturdy for the small size.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T.

customer_reviews.title: So useful and packs down to nothing for easy storage.
customer_reviews.text: A spontaneous work surface. It's a crazy notion but in my cramped garage it's a powerful idea. I have folding tables. I have a larger Workmate. However, I find most options are a hassle to set-up. Not this product! It stows flat against the wall, weighs very little, and can be set up in seconds. Yesterday I put my powered compound miter saw on it for a few cuts; no problem. Two days ago I used it to clamp a large gluing project; no problem. I'm impressed with both the product and the value. Rarely is something so useful, substantive, and made of quality at such a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Good

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GARBAGE!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE BEEN ASSEMBLING FURNITURE, WORKBENCHES AND OTHER PROJECTS FOR 45 YEARS AND THIS IS THE BIGGEST PEICE OF JUNK I HAVE EVER ASSEMBLED. WHAT TRASH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Girman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but...
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected but due to low price it is a bit flimsy. I am comparing it with a workmate that I bought many, many years ago and it's not near as solid but again at this price point I didn't expect much. It does however do what I need it to do and for that I would recommend it as long as you don't expect more than it can deliver. Didn't take long to assemble and as one previous review stated I replaced the roll pins provided for securing the screw knobs with a machine screw and nut.
customer_reviews.author: FAS

customer_reviews.title: Assembly manual is vague and incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Assembly manual is vague and incomplete. There is no mention in the parts list or image of the 2 spacers. At about 46 seconds in the manufacture's video on assembling the bench on YouTube [Amazon will not let post the URL where you view this necessary video, you could try searching with Bing or Google for "How to Assemble Your Workmate 125".] the spacers are visible and you shown where to install them. Assembly is not hard but I think a rank amateur at assemble would likely be overwhelmed. I can't comment on how well the bench works because I haven't used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: EMudgeSr

customer_reviews.title: I read some reviews that weren't happy with the clamping power or weight limits or other ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this partly because I used to have one if its predecessors and partly because of the price. I read some reviews that weren't happy with the clamping power or weight limits or other aspects that frankly I think were unfair to expect from a workbench of this type. If you need it to function and a strong vice or support 500 lbs maybe it's time to invest in a proper work bench and a vice grip. But if you need a great little work bench for mobile projects or quick setup/cleanup I don't think you can do much better than this little guy. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A. Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great work bench for small projects.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little lightweight work bench for small projects around the house. I just purchased my second one to use as a semi-permanent miter saw stand. I found putting it together was fairly straight forward despite other reviewers saying it was a challenge. The only thing it's missing that I wish it had was an insert that you could place between the two wood pieces when fully opened to provide a larger work area. But for the price I really can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Josh F.

customer_reviews.title: IT'S O.K.
customer_reviews.text: Works as I expected, but kind of small. I am used to the full size workmate, but don't have the space for that model. I gave it to my son and now use this down sized model.. PROS: compact design, folds easily, clamps tight and even at angles when projects demand. reasonably priced. CONS: really small for any decent projects, not really stable, threads on clamps need to be oiled regularly or they will hang up...
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, in all sense of the word
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheap, and should do its job. But there are some serious drawbacks. The instructions are wrong, and it’s literally impossible to assemble in the order indicated in the instructions. The pins for the handles can’t be inserted as described, go buy machine screws instead. They also included the wrong type of bolts for the top, which could not be tightened. Overall it’s cheap and will do the job once you go buy different hardware than what it ships with. There’s an instructional video online that you should use instead of the printed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for my DIY projects!
customer_reviews.text: I love this work bench. I was hesitate to order after reading some of the reviews. After reading the details from guitarguy review I decided to proceed with the purchase. I picked up the few inexpensive items from my local hardware store. The end results I’m a happy owner of a great work bench. Thank you guitarguy for sharing your review, knowledge and pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy bench for the money
customer_reviews.text: Simple and sturdy bench for the money. I read some bad reviews given because of poorly written assembly instructions which I agree it is a little difficult to follow but unless your are total idiot when it comes to handiness, you should be able to put it together in under 30 minutes. I thought the assembly process was fun and amusing. I have only used this once to cut an aluminum rod off a yard sign and I liked how easy it was to pull out of garage, use and put back. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GaGa

customer_reviews.title: ok.. so i wasnt expecting much, just ...
customer_reviews.text: ok.. so i wasnt expecting much, just something to save a little extra space to work on stuff. i threw some 2x4s on the legs to raise the height and make sure there wasnt any wobble... this little table has become indespensible.. not sure about the clamps that it came with, i will stick with c clamps.. and the way the table vises together makes for an unbelievable amount of ways to secure your work. i use it for metal and wood work.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: For no more than what I do, a simple bench like this is perfect. In fact, I intend to purchase at least two more, maybe three. They can be a work bench (although a little low for my preference), hold large tools like a compound miter saw or a small drill press, saw horses for a circular saw or jigsaw, etc. If you don't have the space for a large, permanent, dedicated bench, get yourself one of these. I'm sure you'll appreciate the versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Saw table
customer_reviews.text: Its OK. It is NOT easy to assemble.the intructions are...ok..but its mostly a picture to look at. Couldve been made more simple to assemble..could be shipped folded and assembled. But...was it 29$?...i think it was...so..if you're wondering..its definitely worth it for 29$. And it folds up decently...watch your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Jc James

customer_reviews.title: It's not from Scotland, do it must be...
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions are garbage. Which in this case, insults garbage. One of the rails was bent and had to be bent back into shape. Once I figured out the instructions where incorrect, exercised my grown up traffic language, and got the thing together... it wobbles. Last Black and Decker product for me.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harrelson

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple of these Workmates for a LONG time. They have been repaired multiple times and the wood top of one of them was breaking up so I decided to just order a new one. I was a little disappointed in how thin the metal is now (I measured it with a micrometer, and the metal on the old versions is about 50% thicker). Also, the wood pieces are only held in place now with one bolt per side rather than two as they used to be. I modified to make it stronger, but not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Dee

customer_reviews.title: Still a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was somewhat amused by the negative comments regarding instructions and assembly. I thought to myself, "How difficult can it be to put a simple workbench together?" Well, it can be very difficult if you try to follow the directions, but if common sense prevails it will get put together - and once it is together it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wargo

customer_reviews.title: Go to UTube for accurate instructions.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice little work bench and I would rate it a 5 star if it weren’t for a pathetic instruction booklet. If not for a Utube video I would be returning it. Black and Decker left out 1 item in one illustration and referred me to another illustration that didn’t exist. I expect better from B&D.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Throwback to my childhood
customer_reviews.text: I remember my dad had one or two of these and I never understood them... until now. I picked up a pair instead of getting traditional horses because of the dynamic nature of these things. While I haven't vised anything just yet, I'm looking forward to seating a miter saw or at least holding some board I end up handsawing. Fantastic sturdy gear that adds some movable space to your project - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dangerous

customer_reviews.title: Mind numbing
customer_reviews.text: having an engineering background and many skills I had no trouble assembling the stant UNTIL I GOT TO THE MOVABLE SLIDE PARTS the directions are horrible. After trying to put the pins thru the shaft to hold the handles I finally discovered they are the wrong size. The parts that are provided to make it slide became a mystery and are not explained in the directions. I never would have purchased it if I knew how much time it would take to put together. It makes a sturdy stand and I am using it without the vise feature.. Keep looking for something assembled or with fewer parts to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Parts
customer_reviews.text: There are 4 sets of bolt holes for the legs/brackets. Only 3 sets line up. When I assembled the legs the Right Side is uneven. I’m pretty sure it’s the wrong part. Now I find myself debating if it’s worth tearing apart and sending back. The instructions are little help. They refer to diagrams that don’t exist.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: If I could have gotten it back in the box I would have shipped this hunk of junk back. The pins to hold the handles didn’t work, no matter what we did. So I had to modify. I am the person who actually enjoys reading instructions but these have steps done in the picture and never write how they got there. Basically you get a box of parts and have to “figure it out”. Step 6 is the worst. Low price but you get what you pay for. My error.
customer_reviews.author: J Olson

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it's so inexpensive for the quality of the item!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Workmate 125 and assembled it and it's really a nice work bench and I can't believe that it is so inexpensive for the quality you get. It's sturdy and very well made! I live in a one bedroom apartment and have needed a table to work on different things for quite a while but never had the room. This thing folds up for easy storage and I can bring it out any time I need a work bench. I have very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiiboy58

customer_reviews.title: Practical...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my several times a year household projects. The vice works well and it is plenty sturdy. When folded it is small enough to fit into a closet. One issue I had was the assembly instructions which seemed poorly written and illustrated. I finally went to the B&D website and watched the assembly video which made everything clear. Another issue was one of the sliding block bolts would not screw into the frame. I finally had to pound it in a little with a hammer to get it in.
customer_reviews.author: NorthghostTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Nice as an accessory only
customer_reviews.text: This is okay for my purposes but if you are looking for a sturdy work surface, get the Workmate that has a more solid base, or one of the other portable work benches on the market. I had one of the other workmates for over 20 years and it served well as a general worktable for most of my projects. This one fills in as an accessory in addition to the solid built-in tool bench I have. It might be helpful for clamping some things but has its limitations for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Woodburner

customer_reviews.title: Great, Sturdy Little Workbench for $28!
customer_reviews.text: I jumped on the bandwagon and built a garden, and needed a stable workplace for my 10" siding miter saw, and this little table fit the bill! And once I was finished, I folded it up and put it in the garage, very nice and easy. I do recommend using "C" clamps to secure the saw so it doesn't slide off, but it worked perfectly! Way to go B&D.
customer_reviews.author: JLL

customer_reviews.title: Diy necessity
customer_reviews.text: Like outweighs dislike, before I had this tool my hands were hurting and was an unsafe way to work. I feel this is a necessity for diy folks and is at a price point that's not ignorable. The rating for folding, it is not very convenient but knowing the price point I should not complain.
customer_reviews.author: Baner

customer_reviews.title: The best $26 I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly useful tool for anyone doing occasional carpentry. It is a foldable stand with the ability to clamp wood tight for sawing or other manipulation. This if the least expensive member of this part of the Black and Decker line. The low cost was offset by marvelous reviews. My experience verified those reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good Product -  Good Price - a Few Blemishes
customer_reviews.text: Assembled and ready to go, and in consideration of price, this is a five star product. I dinged it one star because the instructions are poorly written, and INCORRECT is some places. B&D could do a much better job. I dinged it a second star because the tolerances were slightly off and one piece had an out of alignment tab I had to bend back into position. I gave one star back because anyone who uses a workbench like this can usually figure out poor instructions and is handy at working around tolerances and the like. So, all said, a four star review.
customer_reviews.author: Jay P. in VA

customer_reviews.title: Small jobs only
customer_reviews.text: Considering my budget and the use I'll make of it, the product itself is exactly what I needed to. The plastic pieces feel definitely cheap and you don't need to be a medium to know it's not gonna last forever but for that price you get what you paid for. I personally had no problems with the assembly as other reviews pointed out, just make sure to check the video on youtube and it's gonna take you 20mins to be done with it. The only shade on that transaction : Amazon sent me a refurbished item instead of a new one, would check twice if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: MikaL

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine and works as intended, but the instructions were awful! Some steps were omitted and some pictures didn't seem to fit with the step provided. Fortunately, I had just assembled a month prior an older, almost identical model and had those instructions to refer to as well as the older model to use as an example.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, perfect height for me, but instructions are off
customer_reviews.text: I like this workbench, but I wanted to point out that they have a mistake in their instruction manual. In the first assembly diagram, L and R are reversed. I thought I was going to lose my mind until it suddenly dawned on this old editor/proofreader what the problem was. Then the whole thing went together quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kistner

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price, Just a little bit unsteady
customer_reviews.text: The bench went together easy enough and makes a nice portable work table. I don't have much room in my apartment for storing things so being able to fold it and place it against the wall in a closet is good! It is a little unsteady though, but for my use it works alright. For the price it is a nice portable work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Hate these things
customer_reviews.text: If I had to do it again I would buy plastic cheap ones. They need greased or something because they do NOT close easily at ALL and squeak when trying. Metal on metal squeak. Took FOREVER to assemble and they are not sturdy or stable. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amber G.

customer_reviews.title: Use it for everything
customer_reviews.text: Durable and very handy. I have had one of the originals for nearly 40 years. Just bought one for my son for Christmas and it looks to be as well made as mine.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D Day

customer_reviews.title: The Work Bench For Anything and Anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: What a great workbench to have! It's super strong and super portable! I can carry this easily and place anything on this with ease. I've worked on my electric bicycle with this, I've drilled, sawed, sanded and soldered on this workbench! I recommend anyone to use this workbench!
customer_reviews.author: Jude Alsasua

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be beat for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat this bench for under $30. Great for occasional jobs that something better than perching your work on a chaise lounge or lawn chair. Highly recommended if you live in an apartment or other smallish space. Caveats: assembly can be slightly challenging; the drift pin that holds the vise handle on I found difficult to drive in - I had to run a drill bit through the hole to break down the finish before I could drive the pin in. Other than that, piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: John Neidhart

customer_reviews.title: For me, it works, but woukd b flimsy for anything serious.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a 4 star because it's a bit of a pain to assemble. If u have a ratchet set, definitely use to assemble. If I was using this to do what they picture, I doubt it would work well. Kinda flimsy for a vice. I needed a work bench that could be put away, and would allow me to mount my jewelers saw vice to. And this does that. I will probably insert some wood between the vice so my work area is larger. It doesn't wiggle when I'm sawing copper, or lightly hammering. I can even rest my feet on the cross brace. It's about 29" tall, perfect height for my jewelry making
customer_reviews.author: Teresa1106

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, unbeatable price-point.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cleverly designed, versatile tool. Probably unbeatable for the price. My only bit of advice to a buyer is to be very careful not to strip the thread of the mounting plate. These threads are drilled directly into the sheet metal of the frame, and if these go, you're going to have to do a lot of extra work to make a new thread and get another machine screw the next size up... I drilled a couple of extra holes into the formed bamboo table surfaces and am using this workbench as a portable workstation for a miter saw, for a fraction of the price of a single-purpose miter saw bench!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workbench
customer_reviews.text: Great foldable workbench. Its like having an extra set of hands will doing any kind of job. I had read some reviews about assembly but it took maybe 10 minutes to put it all together. Once together, it is a solid piece of work. Very light and can be easily stored either under a table or put on a mount on the wall. But don't let the weight of it fool you, it can hold some heavy stuff. I had used my miter saw on it and it help up to every. I even had three 4x2s held in place and it did not budge at all. I am even thinking of getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: works for what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: A little rickety, and it definitely wouldn't support anywhere near the maximum weight it claims to be able to support (at least with any sort of stability), but it gets the job done, folds up nice, and gets out of my way as soon as I want it to get out of my way so I can't really complain too much. The price was good and it'll probably last as long as I need it to. All the plastic bits should be ok as long as I don't abuse them.
customer_reviews.author: C. JacksonTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: I like putting things together so thought the process was fun
customer_reviews.text: I like putting things together so thought the process was fun. Anyone who doesn't like to put things together or put a lot of work into setting something up will not like this product as you have to assemble it. It works great for the small wood cutting jobs I have and have not had any complaints yet. Very useful and folds up when you don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Me!Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: HUGE thanks to GuitarGuy1228 for the video assembly tip. Still, it took me a week to get up the nerve to tackle the assembly. Some stupid errors on my part but, in the end, it came together. I did use the cotter pins to put the handles on. At some point, I may change that but it will be a while. Simple, effective and I am happy to have this. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: QueenOPearls

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Iread all the reviews and ordered this product with some trepidation. I do not see what all the fuss was about, it was simple, intuitive and quick. I did add the bolts to the handles and the legs as was suggested and it made sense to do so for a couple of bucks, other than that it is stable works well and seems to be well built for light home use. What more could I ask for for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Its a little on the flimsy side and wouldnt recommend for daily/hardcore use. I bought this for my makita mitre saw and was able to secure to the the stand using the orange blocks as many others were able to do without issue. For the twenty bucks I paid for this its a good purchase and so far has held up, but I don't foresee this lasting for years even for my casual use.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Wow once past assembly!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The directions are useless. If your a woman or a dumb guy forget it. Otherwise this thing is totally awesome once you finally get past the useless directions! I can stand on this, even though it's not meant to be a ladder! Holds chop saw and me to!
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works Mate!
customer_reviews.text: This work bench makes projects so much easier. The vice + cleats are easy and intuitive. The legs are stable. It's a life-saver and probably the best $30 I've spent for my garage. It's not quite as useful as proper saw horses, clamps, and a door blank but it's a lot more convenient. Assembly was pretty easy outside of getting the pin into the handle at the end, that was challenging but the instructions were still clear and it was assembled and usable within 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good working height
customer_reviews.text: I used this for holding the lower unit of my 60 hp yamaha outboard in place while.I service the impeller. Made the job very convenient held the unit in place securely and at a comfortable working height. I'm sure I will use it for other projects as time goes by, but as of right now, if all I ever use it for is as a specialty tool for working on the lower unit of an outboard, then I have already made money form the first use.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were a little unclear but that could be because I put it together at 6 in the morning so I could use it for a project that day. That being said, this work bench is AMAZING. Great for all projects! Made a kitchen table and used the bench for sawing, drilling pocket holes and then holding the table top to sand and stain. This little guy is just perfect for those with smaller workspaces or need the storing convenience. Absolutely recommend for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Harbour H.

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased to see that although there were a few design ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 35 year-old Workmate that has now gained a new permanent home in my son's workshop. I was pleased to see that although there were a few design changes to the way the unit folds up and opens, it is essentially the same. It went together easily, except for the last step of securing the handles to the unit with some pins. They said to hammer them into place, but I found it easier to push them using a C-clamp to exert pressure on the pin.
customer_reviews.author: figsgrandpa

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble; price/performance is okay
customer_reviews.text: The product price/performance deserves a 4 star but due to the difficulties in assembly, I will give it 3. The metal handle pins are too big to be hammered into holes on the vise rails. I have to hammer them to the right size to fit. The rest of the assembly is a bit more complicated than it should. The overall design lacks precision but at this price, it's a useful work bench for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: tobewiser

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: My workshop is setup in a single car garage. Even though i have a stationary workbench and another one on casters, having to move around or outside for simple rough cutting or painting etc., this bench was fairly easy to assemble , fold and carry around the house. I really like the vise function with bench dogs and helps me to clamp the pieces down quickly. Speed and mobility is all i needed
customer_reviews.author: Balaji Natarajan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but missing items
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bench for light work, inexpensive. Mine was missing the manual, which forced me to watch the uTube video... which was better and helpful in the end. 2 bolts were wrong so I couldn’t finish one of the top boards. Have to go to hardware store to match with the others bolts. Not worth the time & effort of returning. Folds up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker WM 125 is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to support my boat outboard's lower unit when changing my water impeller. It works wonderfully for this. I also like using it for wood gluing a vertical piece of wood to a horizontal. I was a little frustrated with all the assembly required but it isn't really that difficult. There are Black and Decker YouTube videos explaining how to assemble this item as well as other ideas on how to use the WM125.
customer_reviews.author: tuna can

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wooow...... Awesome. Is it hard to assemble .... seriously !!!!!!!! how can one do the work of a handy man on this table if its hard to assemble. it took me less than 20 mins to assemble it fully. Yes the pins to put in needs a hammer and are a bit tricky but for the price its an awesome product, fixed all my closets and new cabinets and cutting of board on it. nice to carry and fold.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleem

customer_reviews.title: The instructions aren't the clearest but it was relatively easy once I figured out what I was doing
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means "handy" and I didn't have too much trouble assembly this. I didn't see the assembly warnings prior to ordering it so I was a little worried when it came. It took me about a half an hour to assemble. The instructions aren't the clearest but it was relatively easy once I figured out what I was doing. I probably spend more time trying to fit the pins in the handles than anything else. Other than that, for the price I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: WM125 was ok but assembly instructions were absolutely inept
customer_reviews.text: At least all the parts were there and I finally found assembly instructions on the Internet that made sense. But the manual that came with the parts was inaccurate, missing illustrations, and confusing to say the least. Where is their Quality Control to produce instructions like that? Took me about 3 hours to get it assembled when it should have been about 30 minutes. I had to write this so that others that purchase the product know what they are in for!
customer_reviews.author: Retired IT Analyst

customer_reviews.title: Nice work table for small spaces, sturdier than it seems like it would be.
customer_reviews.text: This took about 45 minutes to assemble, the most difficult part being the steel roll pins that hold the handles in place. Those were a pain to install and took quite a bit of pounding and a pair of channel lock pliers to finally squeeze them into place. The wooden top feels solid and seems to be of good quality. The table itself feels very sturdy, especially for the cheap price and folding ability. Had those roll pins not been such a pain in my behind, I would have given this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Escape 86 Media

customer_reviews.title: Loose Leg Foot Covers
customer_reviews.text: Uses laminated wood for the clamping boards. I'm hoping they will stay straighter than the sawdust composition boards used on competing brands. Easy enough to assemble, but leg foot covers and slide bolt nuts will fall off. Used wood glue on the leg foot covers and the screws and the parts seem more secure now. Its sturdy enough to sand 36 inch 1x6's on so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: BurninEmber

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing. I've been wanting some kind of bench vise and haven't been able to afford what I want so I got this in the mean time for a project. It's been really helpful in so many applications and it was on sale for a great price, so I'm don't regret it at all. It was also very easy to put together and I have it easily accessible in my shop. I gave it four stars because it certainly didn't impress me and a lot of the crank parts are really cheap. I've had it about six months and used it to help with two or three projects and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable workbench!
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal! Assembly was easy - when it says to put the back plate on, do the front logo'd one first, so you will know which way the back one goes on. My 10" Ryobi miter saw fits on the table but does not have any position to be clamped in with the bench clamps. So I zip tied it on. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: A very decent portable workbench for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had one this many years ago and it lasted decades. Overall a good fold-able workbench. The only issues I had were with the assembly. I found IKEA instructions far more legible- a few more accurate drawings would have helped. That aside- probably the best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Horkenator

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Workmate Portable Workbench, 350-Pound Capacity (WM125)
product_meta.description:
Style:Portable WorkbenchBLACK and DECKER 'WorkMate Original Jaws' resist warping and swelling. Quality steel tube construction for durability. Includes swivel pegs and integral retention grooves in jaws for versatility and holding reliability in clamping different materials. Opens and closes eas ily for simple set up and clean up. Specifications: Bench Height - 29-3/4; Parallel Clamping - 4-5/8; Diagonal Clamping - 24; Parallel Peg Clamping - 10-3/4; Diagonal Peg Clamping - 22-3/8; Work Surface - 9x 24; Weight Capacity-350 lbs. Amazon.com Black & Decker WM125 Workmate 125 350 Pound Capacity Portable Work Bench is a necessity for the serious craftsman. Weighing only 15 pounds, this heavy-duty workbench holds up to 350 pounds to accommodate a wide variety of projects. Dual clamp cranks and four swivel pegs can be angled for unique jobs when clamping a variety of materials. Jaws resist swelling and warping over time. Non-skid feet prevent sliding while you work. The bench folds flat for compact storage.

AMAZON.COM
Black & Decker WM125 Workmate 125 350 Pound Capacity Portable Work Bench is a necessity for the serious craftsman. Weighing only 15 pounds, this heavy-duty workbench holds up to 350 pounds to accommodate a wide variety of projects. Dual clamp cranks and four swivel pegs can be angled for unique jobs when clamping a variety of materials. Jaws resist swelling and warping over time. Non-skid feet prevent sliding while you work. The bench folds flat for compact storage.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Workmate 125 holds a robust 350-pounds on its work surface. Open and close the Workmate with the dual clamp cranks which offer increased clamping force and versatility. The rubber non-skid-feet prevent the unit from sliding around as you do your projects. At only 15-pounds, you will get portability without increased fatigue. Folds flat for easy storage. The workmate 125 includes four swivel pegs for added versatility and reliability in clamping different materials.

See more
feature_bullets: Measures 33.3 by 5 by 5 inches; Weighs 17.8 pounds
Included components: WM125 project center, (4) swivel pegs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,375 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
